    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection(java.util.List<Connection> connections)
        Creates a basic connection-object without specifying the two edges to be connected.
        Parameters:
        connections - The list of existing connections

      • Connection

        public Connection(Edge masterEdge,
          Edge slaveEdge,
          java.util.List<Connection> connections)
        Creates a connection-object, specifying the two edges to be connected.
        Parameters:
        masterEdge - The edge contained by the shape considered to be master (will not be moved when connecting the two shapes)
        slaveEdge - The edge contained by the shape considered to be slave (will be moved/rotated when connecting the two shapes)
        connections - The list of existing connections

    • Method Detail

        public static java.util.List<Connection> getConnections()

        The list of all existing connections

        public boolean isSelected()
        Returns:
        The current selection-status of the connection

      • mouseOver

        public boolean mouseOver(Vector2D mousePosition)
        Creates a rectangle around the representation of the connection and checks if the given mousePosition is within this rectangle
        Parameters:
        mousePosition - The position of the mouse
        Returns:
        true if the given mousePosition is within the rectangle created around the connection

      • undoConnection

        public void undoConnection()
        Undos a connection between two edges. Removes the tenons from the edges, unlocks the edges and sets the number of connections of the connected shapes to the correct number.

      • recalculateConnectedEdge

        private void recalculateConnectedEdge(Edge edge)

      • connect

        public java.lang.String connect()
        Connects the two edges of the connection if possible and returns a success/error-message based on whether or not the connection could be made.
        Returns:
        A message that either reports success or contains a description of the problem encountered when trying to connect the edges

      • isEqualEdge

        private boolean isEqualEdge(Edge masterEdge,
                  Edge slaveEdge)

      • lockConnection

        public void lockConnection(boolean locked)
        Sets the locked-variable of the two edges of the connection to the given boolean value.
        Parameters:
        locked - The value the locked-variable of the two edges is set to

      • setAngle

        public void setAngle(float angle)
        Sets the angle between the two shapes that are connected.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle between the two shapes connected by this connection in degrees

      • connectEdges

        public void connectEdges(Edge masterEdge,
                Edge slaveEdge,
                float angle)
        Aligns and connects two given edges and their shapes in 3D-space at a given angle.
        Parameters:
        masterEdge - the edge of the shape that is considered master (will not be moved during this operation)
        slaveEdge - the edge of the shape that is considered slave (will be moved/rotated to the master)
        angle - the angle between master and slave

      • alignEdges

        private void alignEdges(GShape slave,
              Edge masterEdge,
              Edge slaveEdge)

        public float getAngle()
        Returns:
        The current angle between the two shapes connected by this connection
